features: Pocket-size dash camera features two 180-degree field of view lenses that record in tandem to provide complete video coverage around the driver
1440p Garmin Clarity HDR records crisp video details; 720p interior-facing lens with night vision featuring our exclusive NightGlo technology captures clear video of all passengers at night

Features voice control and built-in GPS to automatically capture where and when events occur, plus built-in Wi-Fi connectivity lets you view and share video on your smartphone by using the Garmin Drive smartphone app

Dash Cam Auto Sync feature lets you control and play back synchronized video from up to 4 dash cameras (additional dash cams sold separately) on your smartphone by using the Garmin Drive smartphone app
Includes charger with an extra USB port so drivers can power their phone or another device while on the go
Parking mode lets drivers automatically record motion in front of and inside the vehicle when the car is parked and turned off (may require cable, sold separately)
Ready to use right out of the box with included microSD memory card

Notice: Some jurisdictions regulate or prohibit use of this device. It is your responsibility to know and comply with applicable laws and rights to privacy in jurisdictions where you plan to use this device.
body.description: Make sure you’re covered from every angle with Garmin Dash Cam Tandem. This compact dual-lens dash camera features two 180-degree lenses recording in tandem to provide drivers with complete video coverage day and night. The front-facing lens records in super HD 1440p to capture crisp footage showing critical vehicle details, while the interior lens has night vision featuring exclusive NightGlo technology to see all driver and passenger activity in any light. The charger includes an extra USB port, letting drivers charge their phone on the go. Use voice commands (available in English, German, French, Spanish, Italian and Swedish) to control the camera — hands-free — while built-in GPS shows when and where events occurred and incident detection automatically saves video before and after an incident. Easily view and share video from your smartphone by using the Garmin Drive app (requires a compatible smartphone enabled with GPS and BLUETOOTH Low Energy technology).

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Dual-lens Dash Cam with Two 180-degree Lenses Pocket-size dash camera features two 180-degree field of view lenses that record in tandem to provide complete video coverage around the driver1440p Garmin Clarity HDR records crisp video details; 720p interior-facing lens with night vision featuring our exclusive NightGlo technology captures clear video of all passengers at nightFeatures voice control (available in English, German, French, Spanish, Italian and Swedish) and built-in GPS to automatically capture where and when events occur, plus built-in Wi-Fi connectivity lets you view and share video on your smartphone by using the Garmin Drive app (requires a compatible smartphone enabled with GPS and BLUETOOTH Low Energy technology).Dash Cam Auto Sync feature lets you control and play back synchronized video from up to 4 dash cameras (additional dash cams sold separately) on your smartphone by using the Garmin Drive app (requires a compatible smartphone enabled with GPS and BLUETOOTH Low Energy technology)

GARMIN CLARITY HDR The front-facing lens records crisp 1440p video. That means you’ll get video that’s clear and detailed enough to capture important details. NIGHT VISION The interior lens captures 720p video and includes our exclusive NightGlo technology, so you can record driver and passenger activity even at night. EASILY VIEW VIDEO Built-in Wi-Fi connectivity syncs video to the Garmin Drive app for easy viewing and sharing on your smartphone. (Requires download of the Garmin Drive app to your compatible smartphone enabled with GPS and BLUETOOTH Low Energy technology. See Garmin.com/DriveApp for details.)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Is there any other dash cam?!?
reviews.reviewText: Can't say much for the longevity, but if is like the other 3 I've had, it's not a problem. This is what I've been looking for. Hi resolution front camera, and 180 degree. And a rear camera with infared, and 720p (not my first choice). This camera works well with the drive app, although I find it easier to just hook it to my computer. I bought a nextbase (HUGE mistake), after hearing recordings from it, the Garmin microphone is much better and distorts some with the windows down. The only downside is there is no screen, but it's not the biggest deal, it beeps when you say a command, and you can get on the app and do everything from there. I bought the suction cup mount to make it easier to switch between vehicles. It's actually quite impressive that Garmin packs all of this in such a small package, the nextbase camera is huge and does less than this one does. Another thing to note about this camera is that there is no collision warning, lane departure warning, and speed trap/red light camera warnings on this one, which isn't a big deal to me after the addition to all of the speed traps and such to Google maps. This works well with my keyocera (low model Android) phone when connected to Bluetooth and Android auto. I've been waiting for a camera like this for years now, and I can only hope that Garmin makes a camera that can mount to the exterior of the vehicle in the future, and have it link thru the Garmin drive app, weither it be wired or wireless I don't really care. For anyone that is wondering, I have a 2011 Chevy 3500 pickup for personal, and a 2013 Ford F550 cab chassis truck with a body that will not allow a view out of the back window(company owned). That is why I would like an external camera. I use this camera between the two trucks. This is the best camera money can buy, do not waste your time with anything else. Garmin may time some time to catch up, but when they do, they knock it out of the park!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Garmin should be ashamed
reviews.reviewText: Many bugs, completely unreliable, lack of common sense features, especially in this price range.I have had this camera for about a month, and while the video quality is very good, the rest of the camera is awful.Camera bugs:The camera locks up about when booting every 3-4 parking mode cycles. I cannot be sure what is happening; I just know that when I come back to the car after having parked, the camera will have a flashing green LED. It will need to be power cycled to start working again and there will be one or two parking mode videos making it seem like it locked up hours ago. Since the camera was locked up for all this time, the internal fan will NOT be running even though it's over 120F in the car, so it's likely that the camera also overheated.The Wi-Fi on the camera only seems to work for one connection, and then it won't stay on. I have to power cycle the camera to get it to work again.App issues:The app can be used to make camera settings, and for this it works great. However, it just fails at anything else. For example, video access is ridiculously slow; it takes a full minute just to populate the library page. In the meantime, it just shows an empty library message instead of some kind of progress indication. The app fails to load the library nearly 80% of the time, so you can never be sure if it's loading or just failed again.There is no way to manually mark a video for saving. If you happen to have an event you want to save, you will have to pull the SD card and plug it into a computer to copy the video or else you risk it being overwritten.Lacking features:The only options for parking mode is off, or some timer interval to turn off automatically. I don't understand how there is not a way to 'geofence' the parking mode so that it won't record at home, for example. I don't need an 8 hour video of the inside of my garage.The camera lacks a way to turn it off manually. In the manual, it states that you can just 'disconnect the power'. Well, since it's hard wired with a parking mode cable, that is a little easier said than done.I really wish I had gone with one of the Chinese brands instead of this one. Garmin is a well-known and respected brand that you would expect to make a high-quality and solid product. They really should be ashamed to release a product this bad.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Overall I am satisfied...could be a few tweaks to make it perfect.
reviews.reviewText: A few negatives: product comes with two of sticky magnetic mounts but the one that was inserted into the plastic part of the mount had the clear protective cover missing and I immediately had to use the spare. Sometimes the camera does not seem to connect and start recording automatically. It will flash green instead of solid red for recording. You have to disconnect the power cable and reconnect for it to begin recording as normal. Idk the cause of this. Happens to me periodically, just try to check it often. I use the parking mode cable but at times my vehicle sits for about 4 to 5 days. This causes all power to the camera to shut off bc the battery voltage gets below a certain level. It would be nice if it would still be able to register an impact and record or else you would be OUT OF LUCK if something happened.Pros: camera seems pretty good quality. I was able to throw in a 256GB microsd without doing any crazy formatting like the manual says. The parking mode cable box can be opened and there are a few black plastic jumpers inside where you can adjust the voltage shutoff for the camera so it doesnt drain your battery. I changed mine to 12V instead of 12.3V.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The picture quality and video is superb. Size of the camera is surprising small for what I expected. Unit does generate a bit of heat and I believe may be do the size of the fan/heat sink in the camera really not providing enough draw to remove the heat being built up. Double sided tape to use for the magnet to hold the camera in place is useless. Already has pulled loose 3 times while attempting to remove the camera. FL heat must be to much for it...trying another double sided tape before I attempt to hot glue in place or some other method to keep magnet in place. Not even sure a universal suction cup holder sold by Garmin would hold up. All in all good so far except for a few small glitches/issues. Will use another week or so before buying another unit for the other vehicle to see if I can work the bugs out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to set up and use, very clear pictures
reviews.reviewText: I bought this dash cam because I live in a rural area where people speed like crazy and take dangerous risks on the road like passing on double solid lines going around corners at 100 km+. I've had way too many close calls with crazy drivers over the years. Within weeks of buying this, I had another close call and submitted the video to the local police. The video was very clear (and shows my speed and location) and every time I watch it, I can not believe there was not a serious head-on collision. Thanks to the audio, I said out loud what I could read of the licence plate for evidence. A few minutes later, I saw the car parked at a gas station so stopped and snapped a picture of the full licence plate and the driver. The police presented the driver with a violation ticket and the driver apologized for the incident (haha, ya right... pretty hard to deny crazy scary driving when it's caught on camera.)

Hi there just got my garmin tandem its awesome unfortunately the parking mode will not even show up on the garmin drive app without the parking cable i tried two different power bankes both 5 volt they powered the camera perfectly but you cannot trick the device into thinking its connected to the parking mode cable so what im saying is it has nothing to do with constant power its. All in the cord but i already knew that as per their instructions someone posted a review saying a power bank can be used well its BS so dont believe everything you read that aside this is the best dash cam ever made make sure you by the parking mode cable if you want to use parking mode
Great product. Just a little trouble getting it to save video,but it’s probably a user issue. Highly recommend it.

I had recently brought the dashcam, but it has some connectivity issues when you try to connect it with the phone and the interior visuals are not capturing the right colours in daylight. With the features that I am getting from the dashcam, the price is higher. It doesn’t have the quality for what we spend.
